Articles.Content: Imagine after 10 years, you finally arrive. You get your probe, Phile, and head down to the comet. You land, and bounce because of the low gravity. You land on the dark side, but you still landed. The excitement of landing on a comet for the first time! Wow, if only we had that in KSP. My request, is that someone add a comet or 2 to KSP. I'd love that very much. If you can't do it, I'll do it, it'll take a few weeks though XD.
Making a comet is easy, but getting the tail is what's tricky. The comet itself could be made using Kopernicus, but I have idea idea about the tail.

Kopernicus contains KopernicusExamples archive, which contains Minmus Particles sample.

Color, speed, density, direction, source points are defined in cfg file and look not much complicated.

It is better to watch this yourself than to describe in words.

The coma and tail is just a very nepid atmosphere. It would be interesting to have a feature that increases or decreases the atmospheric density as the body's temperature changes during its elliptical orbit around the Sun!
